question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Concurrency: mutex poisoning] [Lock poisoning] If any function panics while holding a Mutex on ObserverBlockData, does this poison the mutex and prevent all future access to block data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Concurrency: lock ordering] [Deadlock] Can different execution paths acquire locks on ObserverBlockData and internal store structures in different orders, causing deadlock? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Concurrency: callback execution] [Concurrent callbacks] Can commit callbacks execute in parallel on different threads, causing concurrent mutable access to stores even through Mutex? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Concurrency: Arc cloning] [Reference counting overflow] Can excessive Arc::clone() operations on ObserverBlockData cause reference count overflow over very long chain history? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Memory: payload lifetime] [Use-after-free] After payloads are removed from block_payload_store, can dangling references to payload data exist in ordered or pending stores causing UAF? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Memory: PipelinedBlock lifetime] [Memory leak] Are Arc<PipelinedBlock> references properly released when blocks are removed, or do circular references prevent cleanup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Memory: PipelineFutures] [Future leak] When get_parent_pipeline_futs returns futures, if those futures are never polled/awaited, do they leak resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Memory: BTreeMap growth] [Unbounded memory] Can BTreeMaps in stores grow without bounds during attack scenarios (e.g., flood of invalid blocks), causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Crypto: signature verification bypass] [Unverified payload acceptance] Can setting verified_payload_signatures=true in insert_block_payload bypass actual cryptographic verification, allowing invalid payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Crypto: quorum cert validation] [QC verification bypass] Does get_parent_pipeline_futs validate that the quorum cert in block is properly signed before using it to determine parent? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Crypto: epoch state mismatch] [Wrong validator set] If verify_payload_signatures is called with epoch_state from wrong epoch, can payloads be verified against incorrect validator set? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Crypto: aggregate signature] [Signature aggregation attack] Can an attacker exploit aggregate signature verification to create valid-looking signatures for invalid payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Consensus: fork safety] [Fork acceptance] Can blocks from multiple competing forks be present simultaneously in ordered_block_store, breaking fork-choice rule? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Consensus: commit safety] [Premature commit] Can update_ordered_block_commit_decision mark blocks as committed before they're actually final, breaking consensus safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Consensus: liveness] [Block starvation] Can pending blocks accumulate without payloads arriving, causing liveness failure where consensus cannot progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Consensus: round progression] [Round skip] Can blocks skip rounds in ordered_block_store, allowing gaps that violate consensus round progression rules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Consensus: three-chain rule] [Commit rule violation] Does the code properly enforce Aptos' three-chain commit rule, or can blocks be committed prematurely breaking safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Test: ObservedOrderedBlock::new_for_testing] [Test code in production] Can ObservedOrderedBlock::new_for_testing be called in production code, bypassing proper validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Test: dummy data] [Dummy data acceptance] Can StateComputeResult::new_dummy() or QuorumCert::dummy() be exploited in production to inject invalid consensus state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Integration: BlockPayloadStore] [Payload store consistency] Can BlockPayloadStore internal state become inconsistent with ObserverBlockData assumptions about payload existence and verification status? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Integration: OrderedBlockStore] [Ordered block consistency] Can OrderedBlockStore's highest_committed tracking diverge from actual commits tracked in ObserverBlockData.root? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Integration: PendingBlockStore] [Pending block stale data] Can PendingBlockStore retain stale pending blocks that reference old epochs, causing confusion during epoch transitions? (Medium)
